intro: Spermacoce glabra f. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf moonflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom at night. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. This variety is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to the typical form of Spermacoce glabra.
